medical_history.chief_complaint: Concern about family history of colonic polyps and cancer.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient felt well with no abdominal pain, changes in bowel habits, rectal bleeding, or weight loss. A colonoscopic examination four years earlier did not identify polyps.
medical_history.family_history: Mother diagnosed with colon cancer at 75. Father had recurrent pancreatitis and underwent surgeries for large villous adenoma and multiple polyps. Brother had multiple adenomas identified and a right hemicolectomy. Paternal aunts and grandparents had various cancers.
medical_history.social_history: Does not smoke and rarely consumes alcohol.
